lib/lb/dcbpb.c

00001 /**********************************************************doxygen*//** @file
00002  *  @brief   Degree constarined bottleneck paths bound
00003  *
00004  *  Implemenation of the degree constrained bottleneck paths bound (DCBPB) 
00005  *  used as a lower bound for the Bottleneck TSP objective value.
00006  *
00007  *  @author  John LaRusic
00008  *  @ingroup lib
00009  ****************************************************************************/
00010 #include "common.h"
00011 #include "lb.h"
00012 
00013 /**
00014  *  @brief  Solves the all-pairs bottleneck paths problem (a simple
00015  *          modification of the Floyd-Warshall alg for all-pairs shortest
00016  *          paths).
00017  *  @param  problem [in] problem data
00018  *  @param  ignore [in] vertex number to ignore
00019  *  @param  b [out] array will hold bottleneck path value for each
00020  *              pair of source/sink nodes
00021  */
00022 void
00023 bottleneck_paths(arrow_problem *problem, int ignore, int **b);
00024 
00025 /*
00026  *  @brief  Returns the max of the four values
00027  *  @param  i [in] first number
00028  *  @param  j [in] second number
00029  *  @param  k [in] third number
00030  *  @param  l [in] fourth number
00031  *  @return the largest of i, j, k, l
00032  */
00033 int
00034 max(int i, int j, int k, int l);
00035 
00036 /****************************************************************************
00037  * Public function implementations
00038  ****************************************************************************/
00039 int
00040 arrow_dcbpb_solve(arrow_problem *problem, arrow_bound_result *result)
00041 {
00042     int ret = ARROW_SUCCESS;
00043     int i, j, k;
00044     int bottleneck, max_tree, min_node;
00045     int in_cost, out_cost;
00046     int n = problem->size;
00047     double start_time, end_time;    
00048     
00049     start_time = arrow_util_zeit();
00050     
00051     int *alpha;
00052     int *gamma;
00053     if(!arrow_util_create_int_array(n, &alpha))
00054     {
00055         ret = ARROW_FAILURE;
00056         goto CLEANUP;
00057     }
00058     if(!arrow_util_create_int_array(n, &gamma))
00059     {
00060         ret = ARROW_FAILURE;
00061         goto CLEANUP;
00062     }
00063     
00064     int **b;
00065     int *b_space;
00066     if(!arrow_util_create_int_matrix(n, n, &b, &b_space))
00067     {
00068         ret = ARROW_FAILURE;
00069         goto CLEANUP;
00070     }
00071     
00072     
00073     bottleneck = INT_MIN;
00074 
00075     for(i = 0; i < n; i++)
00076     {
00077         bottleneck_paths(problem, i, b);
00078         min_node = INT_MAX;
00079         
00080         /*
00081         printf("P^%d\t", i);
00082         for(j = 0; j < n; j++)
00083             if(j != i)
00084                 printf("[%d]\t", j);
00085         printf("\n");
00086         
00087         for(j = 0; j < n; j++)
00088         {
00089             if(j != i)
00090             {
00091                 printf("[%d]\t", j);
00092                 for(k = 0; k < n; k++)
00093                 {
00094                     if((k != j) && (k != i))
00095                     {
00096                         printf("%d\t", b[j][k]);
00097                     }
00098                     else if(j == k)
00099                         printf("-\t");
00100                 }
00101                 printf("\n");
00102             }
00103         }
00104         */
00105         
00106         /* Find the largest bottleneck path values leaving (alpha[j]) and 
00107            entering (gamma[j]) of nodes j and k */
00108         for(j = 0; j < n; j++)
00109         {
00110             if(j != i)
00111             {
00112                 alpha[j] = INT_MIN;
00113                 gamma[j] = INT_MIN;
00114              
00115                 for(k = 0; k < n; k++)
00116                 {
00117                     if((k != j) && (k != i))
00118                     {
00119                         if(alpha[j] < b[j][k]) alpha[j] = b[j][k];
00120                         if(gamma[j] < b[k][j]) gamma[j] = b[k][j];
00121                     }
00122                 }
00123             }
00124         }
00125         
00126         /*
00127         for(j = 0; j < n; j++)
00128         {
00129             if(j != i)
00130                 printf("alpha[%d] = %d; gamma[%d] = %d\n", j, alpha[j], j, gamma[j]);
00131         }  
00132         printf("\n");
00133         */
00134         
00135         for(j = 0; j < n; j++)
00136         {
00137             if(j != i)
00138             {
00139                 out_cost = problem->get_cost(problem, i, j);
00140                 if(out_cost < min_node)
00141                 {
00142                     for(k = 0; k < n; k++)
00143                     {
00144                         if((k != i))
00145                         {
00146                             in_cost = problem->get_cost(problem, k, i);
00147                             if(in_cost < min_node)
00148                             {
00149                                 max_tree = 
00150                                     max(alpha[j], gamma[k], out_cost, in_cost);
00151                                 if(max_tree < min_node) min_node = max_tree;
00152                             }
00153                         }
00154                     }
00155                 }
00156             }
00157         }
00158         
00159         if(bottleneck < min_node)
00160             bottleneck = min_node;
00161     }
00162     end_time = arrow_util_zeit();
00163 
00164     result->obj_value = bottleneck;
00165     result->total_time = end_time - start_time;
00166     
00167 CLEANUP:
00168     if(alpha != NULL) free(alpha);
00169     if(gamma != NULL) free(gamma);
00170     if(b_space != NULL) free(b_space);
00171     if(b != NULL) free(b);
00172     return ret;
00173 }
00174 
00175 /****************************************************************************
00176  * Private function implementations
00177  ****************************************************************************/
00178 void
00179 bottleneck_paths(arrow_problem *problem, int ignore, int **b)
00180 {
00181     int i, j, k, max;
00182     
00183     /* Initialize! */
00184     for(i = 0; i < problem->size; i++)
00185     {
00186         for(j = 0; j < problem->size; j++)
00187             b[i][j] = problem->get_cost(problem, i, j);
00188         b[i][i] = INT_MAX;
00189     }
00190     
00191     /* Dynamic programming technique GO! */
00192     for(k = 0; k < problem->size; k++)
00193     {
00194         if(k != ignore)
00195         {
00196             for(i = 0; i < problem->size; i++)
00197             {
00198                 if((i != ignore) && (k != i))
00199                 {
00200                     for(j = 0; j < problem->size; j++)
00201                     {
00202                         if((j != ignore) && (k != j) && (i != j))
00203                         {
00204                             max = (b[i][k] > b[k][j] ? b[i][k] : b[k][j]);
00205                             if(max < b[i][j])
00206                                 b[i][j] = max;
00207                         }
00208                     }
00209                 }
00210             }
00211         }
00212     }
00213 }
00214 
00215 int
00216 max(int i, int j, int k, int l)
00217 {
00218     int max = i;
00219     if(max < j) max = j;
00220     if(max < k) max = k;
00221     if(max < l) max = l;
00222     return max;
00223 }
